definition: the Revelation of St John the divine/the Apocalypse
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)

sentences.english: Can you imagine the author of Revelation saying that?
sentences.chinese: 你能想象《启示录》的作者说这种话吗？

sentences.english: The appearance of Apocalymon was recorded in a prophetic book from ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 太古的预言书记录下来了启示录兽的出现。

sentences.english: With Revelation we see this heavily anti-Roman view.
sentences.chinese: 在《启示录》里，我们看到了这个极度反罗马的观点。

sentences.english: The writer of Revelation would have disagreed with at completely.
sentences.chinese: 《启示录》的作者完全不同意这个观点。

sentences.english: Then finally you get to the Revelation of John,The Apocalypse.
The Lord introduces the first symbolical language in Revelation.
sentences.chinese: 主说明了启示录中第一个象征的语言。

sentences.english: Solve the mysteries and meet the strange characters of a post-apocalyptic world in this one.
sentences.chinese: 揭示奥秘，邂逅启示录世界上奇怪的角色。

sentences.english: It is also used 21 times in the books of Daniel and Revelation.
sentences.chinese: 数字二在但以理书和启示录中也出现了21次。

sentences.english: So it has that Revelation of Peter,again.
sentences.chinese: 所以它也包括彼得启示录。

sentences.english: This is from chapter 14 of the book of Revelation.
And apocalypse just means opening up,revelation.
sentences.chinese: 天启意思是打开，启示录。

sentences.english: John used in The book of Revelation a Jewish style of writing known as Apocalyptic.
sentences.chinese: 约翰用犹太人末世的体裁写启示录。

sentences.english: It looked like the set of a science fiction film about the apocalypse.
sentences.chinese: 这就像科幻电影《现代启示录》里的场景。

sentences.english: Apocalyptic expectations, envisaging the end of the world as we know it .
sentences.chinese: 启示录的期待，展现了我们现在所了解的世界末日。

sentences.english: It's a wonderful book about Revelation.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本关于《启示录》的好书。

sentences.english: The book of Revelation is lousy Greek.Yes sir.
sentences.chinese: 《启示录》的希腊语就很糟，好的，你说。

definition: Book of Exodus/Second Book of Moses
Book of Genesis/First Book of Moses
Book of Job (in the Old Testament)
